intro: Rhodiola himalensis subsp. bouvieri, commonly known as the Himalayan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in harsh mountainous conditions. It is often found growing at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Due to its resilience and unique adaptations, it is of interest in both botanical research and traditional medicine.
